CONFLATION OF TWO QUALITATIVELY DIFFERENT ASYMPTOTIC REGIMES:

The node claims: lim (1/n) log |{nj1,...,nj6}_q| = Vol_hyp(Delta(q,j_i)) for fixed q > 0, q != 1.

The cited references (particularly Belletti-Yang) prove a DIFFERENT result: lim_{r -> inf} (2*pi/r) log |{6j}_{q=exp(2*pi*i/r)}| = Vol_hyp.

These are fundamentally different mathematical statements:

REGIME A (claimed by node): Fixed real q > 0, all spins scale as j_i -> n*j_i with n -> infinity. The q-parameter is FIXED while the representation labels grow. The quantum 6j symbol is computed via the q-Racah formula with REAL q.

REGIME B (proven in literature): q = e^{2*pi*i/r} is a ROOT OF UNITY approaching 1 as r -> infinity. The spins are proportional to r (bounded by Turaev-Viro admissibility). Both q and the spins change together. The quantum 6j symbol is evaluated at a COMPLEX q on the unit circle.

The geometric interpretations differ: In Regime B, the Gram matrix of the tetrahedron has entries cos(theta_ij) where the angles theta_ij are determined by the ratio of spins to r, giving a tetrahedron in hyperbolic/spherical/Euclidean geometry depending on the signature. In Regime A, there is no analogous geometric construction established in the literature.

The node erroneously transplants the proven Regime B result into the unproven Regime A setting. Even the notation is wrong: the Belletti-Yang formula uses (2*pi/r) not (1/n), because the natural scaling in the root-of-unity regime is with respect to r, not n.
